definition[0]: the process of getting official permission or approval for something
example[0]: She’ll race if she gets medical clearance from her doctor.
example[1]: Morris did not have a security clearance.
definition[1]: official permission for a plane to take off or land
example[2]: The pilot requested clearance for an emergency landing.
definition[2]: the removal of unwanted things from a place
definition[3]: the amount of space around one object that is needed for it to avoid touching another object
example[5]: There was less than a foot’s clearance between the ship’s sides and the wharf.
definition[4]: a process by which a cheque goes from one bank to another
definition[5]: an occasion when a player in a game such as football kicks the ball away from his or her goal
definition[6]: permission to sell a product or do a deal
example[6]: The government gave the company clearance for the takeover.
